comment.text: This translation key is used to display "Support & Legal info" in the user interface, specifically in a support block component within an OAuth client form, likely as a header or title. It appears alongside a field where users can input a policy URL, and also in an information dialog box for privacy policies.

usage.context:
lineHeight="20px"
 fontWeight="600"
 noSelect
 truncate
 >
 {t("SupportAndLegalInfo")}
 </Text>
 <Text
 className="privacy-block"
 fontSize="13px"
 lineHeight="15px"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The hyphen in 'Support- & Rechtsinformationen' is slightly unconventional. While not incorrect, a space might improve readability and align better with common German practices.

While "サポート＆法的情報" is technically correct, a more natural and idiomatic translation of "Support & Legal info" in Japanese would be "サポートと法的情報" or "サポートおよび法的情報". Using the ampersand (&) is uncommon in formal Japanese writing and can feel abrupt.
The term 'Legal info' is not accurately translated. 'ຂໍ້ມູນທາງການຜະລິດ' literally translates to 'production information,' which doesn't convey the meaning of legal information or legal notices.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຂໍ້ມູນທາງການທີ່ຖືກຕ້ອງ (information regarding regulations) or ຂໍ້ມູນກົດໝາຍ (legal information)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The ampersand (&) is used in the English content but not consistently represented in the Lao translation. While common in some Lao usage, it's generally preferable to use 'ແລະ' for 'and'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຂໍ້ມູນສະຫນັບສະຫນູນແລະຂໍ້ມູນທາງການທີ່ຖືກຕ້ອງ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Informações legais e de suporte' is understandable, a more accurate and idiomatic translation of 'Support & Legal info' would be 'Suporte e informações legais' or 'Informações de suporte e legais'. The original phrasing implies the support information is legally related, which may not be the intended meaning.

The term 'Support' is better translated as 'Suport' rather than 'Asistență' in this context. 'Asistență' implies a more personalized or direct help, while 'Suport' is a more general term for resources and documentation.

While technically correct, "юридическая информация" is a more formal and legalistic translation than "Legal info" implies. A more natural and user-friendly translation might be "Юридические вопросы" or "Юридическая помощь".

The translation "ආධාර & නීතිමය තොරතුරු" is a literal translation of 'Support & Legal info'. While understandable, a more natural Sinhala phrasing might be 'ප්‍රශ්න හා නීතිමය තොරතුරු' (prashna ha neetimaya thorathuru) or 'උදව් & නීති උපදෙස්' (udaw & neeti upades). 'ආධාර' (aadhara) is closer to 'assistance' or 'help', while 'ප්‍රශ්න' (prashna) implies 'questions' which is often what users are seeking in a support context.

While 'Подршка' is a valid translation for 'Support', 'правне информације' is a more formal translation for 'Legal info'. A more natural and commonly used translation would be something like 'Закони информације' or 'Информације о законима'.
